5. Quote stuffing: This involves rapidly submitting and canceling orders to flood the order book with fake orders and create the illusion of market activity.

Corporate control can be achieved through various means, including mergers and acquisitions, proxy contests, and the use of special voting shares. The mechanics of corporate control involve understanding the different types of voting shares, the voting mechanisms, and the rules governing corporate governance.
### Types of Voting Shares
There are several types of voting shares, including common shares, preferred shares, and special voting shares. Common shares typically carry one vote per share, while preferred shares may carry a higher vote per share or may not be entitled to vote at all. Special voting shares, on the other hand, carry a disproportionate number of votes per share, often used to concentrate control in the hands of a few shareholders.
### Voting Mechanisms
Voting mechanisms can be classified into two categories: majority voting and super-majority voting. Majority voting requires a simple majority of votes to pass a resolution, while super-majority voting requires a higher threshold, such as 75% or 90%, to pass a resolution. The type of voting mechanism used can significantly impact the level of corporate control.
